sentences: Tema südame jäi peale kolmandat infarkti.
context: "Südamesse" is the illative case form of "süda" (heart), meaning "into the heart" or "to the heart." It indicates movement toward or into something. In Estonian, the illative case is used to express direction or destination. The word can refer literally to the physical heart but is also commonly used metaphorically for emotional center, feelings, or innermost being.
